creator: Middleton, Frederick Dobson (Sir), 1825-1898. (author)
description: Middleton, Frederick Dobson (Sir): 1825-1898. English soldier; commanded Canadian militia, 1884-1890; general in charge of the suppression of the Saskatchewan Rebellion, 1885 (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // A reply to his accusers about leadership of the Canadian militia. Under the title, "General Middleton's defence: As contained in his parting address to the people of Canada," it appeared in the Evening Telegram , Toronto, August 12, 1890 and [s.l.: s.n., 1890?] (14p.).
publisher: Printed for F. Middleton by Hunter, Rose & Co. (Toronto)
